caption: TABLE 1: Results on NYU Depth V2.  *  denotes multi-scale test.
TABLE 2: Results on SUN-RGBD.  *  denotes multi-scale test.
TABLE 3: Results on the Stanford2D3D dataset [30].

TABLE 4: Results on the ScanNetV2 test set [31]. Results are 
obtained from the ScanNetV2 benchmark leaderboard.
TABLE 5: Results on the Cityscapes val set in full resolution.
TABLE 6: Per-class results on the MFNet dataset [9] for RGB-Thermal semantic segmentation.

TABLE 7: Segmentation results on daytime-and nighttime images 
on the MFNet dataset [9].
TABLE 8: Per-class results on the ZJU-RGB-P dataset [11] for RGB-Polarization semantic segmentation.
TABLE 9: Results for RGB-Event semantic segmentation.
TABLE 10: Comparison of event representations and time bins.

Table 11. If CM-FRM is ablated, the features will be extracted 
independently in their own branches, and for FFM we simply 
average the two features for semantic prediction. Compared with 
the baseline, using only CM-FRM improves mIoU by 2.5%, using 
only FFM improves mIoU by 1.2%, and together CM-FRM and 
FFM improve the semantic segmentation performance by 3.8%.

TABLE 11: Ablation for CM-FRM/FFM on NYU Depth V2 test 
set.

TABLE 13: Ablation for the second modality on NYU Depth V2 
test set.

TABLE 14: Efficiency results. FLOPs are estimated for inputs of 
RGB (480?640?3) and HHA (480?640?3).
